intro: Hibiscus fanambanensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hibiscus fanambanensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Its botanical traits make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
